availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lloyd Thompson (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Nelson County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles Lloyd Thompson and Elizabeth Thompson. Married to Eleanor Goodrum Thompson in Washington County, Kentucky, on November 21, 1832. Father of John S. Thompson, Mary Thompson, Charles W. Thompson, William L. Thompson, Richard Thompson, Margaret Thompson, Thomas Thompson, and George Thompson. Farmer in Marion County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Marion County in 1850. Owned Henry Jackson in Marion County in 1853. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons, including Mary A. Thompson, in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Marion County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Washington County Marriages, Film #000551244.
